title: 2026 National Veterans Creative Arts Festival | Columbia, SC
summary:
Experience the 2026 National Veterans Creative Arts Festival in Columbia, SC. Co-presented by the Department of Veterans Affairs and the American Legion Auxiliary, the National Veterans Creative Arts Festival is the culmination of VA facility competitions in art, creative writing, dance, drama and music for Veterans enrolled in the VA health care system. Veterans exhibit their gold medal winning artwork, original writings, and perform music, dance or dramatic pieces. All Veterans invited to participate are gold medal winners in a national creative arts competition in which thousands of Veterans enter from VA medical facilities across the nation.

For more information:
https://department.va.gov/veteran-sports/national-veterans-creative-arts-festival/
https://www.va.gov
https://member.legion-aux.org/Home

#veteransaffairs #veteran #arttherapy

title: VA News | Telehealth Success and 100 Years of Innovation
summary:
Explore how VA telehealth services are revolutionizing Veteran health care! U.S. Army Veteran Carmen Drummond shares why more Veterans trust VA Video Connect for mental health appointments, primary care, and routine check-ins—bringing care to your home or on the go.
 
We also celebrate 100 years of VA medical research and spotlight the Million Veteran Program (MVP)—a groundbreaking genetic research study that examines how DNA, lifestyle, and military experience impact Veteran health outcomes. These innovations are shaping the future of Veteran care, telemedicine, and personalized medicine.
 
Learn more:
- VA Telehealth | https://telehealth.va.gov/
- Million Veteran Program | https://www.mvp.va.gov/
 
Thank you for watching—and thank you for your service!
#VANews #Veterans #Telehealth #VAResearch #MVP #VeteranCare #Innovation #VAHealthCare #Telemedicine #MentalHealthSupport #VeteranBenefits

title: Assessing a Shift to Enrollment-Based School Funding
summary: Chapter 442 of 2024 (SB 98, Portantino) requires our office to report on the effects of changing the student count methodology of the Local Control Funding Formula and other K-12 education programs from average daily attendance to student enrollment. In this report, we provide our assessment of such a shift, describe a few policy alternatives that maintain the attendance-based system, and identify key issues for the Legislature to consider if switching to enrollment-based funding.

title: Glad You Asked: Overpayment Scams
summary:
In this episode of Glad You Asked, Deputy Secretary, Paul R. Lawrence, Ph.D. explains how Veterans can recognize legitimate VA communications and avoid falling victim to scams.

He details how VA officially communicates about overpayments, such as through VA.gov or the Debt Management Center at 1-800-827-0648, and offers key safety tips:

    •    Never share your VA login information
    •    Don’t pay upfront fees
    •    Avoid clicking on suspicious links or messages
    •    Never share sensitive personal information
    •    If in doubt, contact VA directly to confirm

Watch now to learn how to protect yourself and ensure you’re only responding to official VA communications.

title: Steel Knight 25: Stingers, Scarface Deliver Persistent Close Air Support Across Distributed Battlespace
summary: Throughout Exercise Steel Knight 25, H-1 attack helicopters with Marine Light Attack Helicopter Squadron (HMLA) 267 and HMLA-367, Marine Aircraft Group 39, 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing, delivered continuous close air support to Marines maneuvering across a geographically dispersed battlespace, reinforcing the wing’s role as the Marine Corps’ premier provider of offensive air support and integrated fires. Steel Knight is an annual exercise that strengthens the Navy–Marine Corps team’s ability to respond forward, integrate across domains and sustain Marine Air-Ground Task Force readiness.

A new report examines how California measures up against other states in the number and restrictive nature of regulations, with a focus on understanding the effects on business launches.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Policy Brief: Business Regulation and Business Starts in California
summary: California is seen as more regulated than other states, and many see regulations as dampening the business climate. While California does not stand out for its number of business regulations, it does stand out for its number of regulatory constraints.

title: Assessment of CSU’s Graduation Initiative 2025
summary: This report focuses on the California State University’s (CSU’s) Graduation Initiative 2025 (GI 2025). This initiative aimed to increase graduation rates and close gaps in graduation rates among particular student groups by 2025. In the report, we provide background on GI 2025, then discuss associated funding and activities. Next, we analyze the outcomes and assess the benefits and drawbacks of GI 2025. Lastly, we make recommendations for the Legislature to consider as it contemplates its involvement in CSU’s next graduation initiative.

title: Assessment of the Strong Workforce Program
summary: This report focuses on the Strong Workforce Program, which the state created to increase the availability and quality of career technical education at the California Community Colleges. We provide background on the program, assess its implementation and outcomes, and raise a few issues to consider relating to coordination of workforce development programs more broadly.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Updating California’s School Funding Formula: Assessing Alternatives and Trade-Offs
summary: California’s school funding formula has boosted funding for high-need students and increased district autonomy. While student outcomes have improved, schools still face fiscal and academic challenges. This report examines how tweaks to the funding system could affect state spending and district allocations, highlighting the trade-offs involved.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Policy Brief: Updating California’s School Funding Formula
summary: We model the state’s school funding system and consider several distinct changes, ranging in cost from $1.5 to $3.8 billion, that could address ongoing challenges. Each change leads to different funding levels across districts and student groups.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: PPIC Statewide Survey: Californians and Their Government
summary: Key findings of the latest survey include: More than seven in ten Californians expect bad economic times in the state and nation in the coming year. Two in three say housing affordability is a big problem in their part of the state, and most are less comfortable making a major purchase than they were six months ago. A majority of likely voters say they are more enthusiastic than usual about voting next November.

title: Cap-and-Invest: November 2025 Auction Update and 2026-27 Budget Context
summary: In this post, we discuss the November 2025 cap-and-invest program auction results, as well as potential implications for the 2026-27 budget.

title: Exposing the Massive Fraud & Political Corruption in Minnesota and California
summary:
Exposing the Massive Fraud & Political Corruption in Minnesota and California

In this episode, we delve into the staggering fraud and corruption that has taken hold in Minnesota and California. We examine how dozens of individuals, predominantly from the East African and Somali communities, have been convicted of stealing over a billion dollars from taxpayer-funded programs during the COVID-19 pandemic. Governor Tim Walz's administration is under scrutiny for its failure to address this, allegedly due to fears of losing political support. We also explore similar issues in California, where illegal immigrants have fraudulently obtained commercial driver's licenses, leading to deadly accidents. This episode highlights the broader impacts of mass immigration and inadequate assimilation on the rule of law in the United States. 00:00 Massive COVID-19 Fraud in Minnesota 00:25 Governor's Response and Accountability 01:24 Political Implications and Media Coverage 02:13 Details of the Fraud Scandal 05:31 Broader Issues of Immigration and Multiculturalism 07:46 Specific Cases of Fraud and Corruption 19:50 Illegal Immigrants and Fraudulent Licenses 35:00 Conclusion and Final Thoughts

title: Red Alert: NYC's Radical Leftist Takeover
summary:
Unveiling New York's Political Shift: Sam Faddis On Radical Changes In this episode of Your LEO Nation, chief Mark Garrett speaks with Sam Faddis, a retired CIA Field Operations Officer, about the recent election in New York City. They discuss the implications of the new mayor's administration on law enforcement and the rule of law. Key topics include the incoming Chief of Staff's radical views, the goals of the Democratic Socialists of America (DSA), and the potential for revolutionary changes in policing policies. Is the future of New York City in jeopardy? How will these changes affect the everyday New Yorker?

Check out Sam's Substack here: https://andmagazine.substack.com/p/the-peoples-republic-of-new-york?utm_campaign=email-post&r=6tmnf1&utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email

title: Examining Non-Citizens as US Law Enforcement Officers
summary:
Examining Non-Citizens as US Law Enforcement Officers

A Deep Dive Join us as we welcome back Mike Wood, author of 'Newhall Shooting: A Tactical Analysis.' We discuss the controversial topic of non-US citizens serving as peace officers across the country, with a focus on recent laws in California. Is this a necessary solution to manpower shortages or a dangerous precedent undermining US sovereignty and rule of law? Tune in as we delve into specific cases, legislative changes, and the broader implications for the law enforcement community and public safety.

Check out Mike's book here - https://www.amazon.com/dp/144024099X?ref_=cm_sw_r_ffobk_cp_ud_dp_VMPDQJP19VKMQYZ0ACVV&bestFormat=true

summary:

title: Welcoming the Montford Point Marine Association California
summary: The California State Commanders Veterans Council is proud to welcome the Montford Point Marine Association California as our newest member. Founded in 1965, the Montford Point Marine Association is dedicated to honoring and preserving the legacy of the first African American Marines who trained at Montford Point, Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, between 1942 and 1949. Despite […]

title: Protecting Veterans’ Benefits: Why California’s SB 694 Should Lead the Nation
summary: An Analytical Brief from CAL EANGUS Leadership A National Issue, A California Solution A recent Washington Post investigation has renewed scrutiny on the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) disability compensation system, alleging widespread overreach, fraud, and inefficiencies. The report described how outdated disability rules, a surge of minor and unverifiable claims, and a lack of enforcement capacity […]

title: California State Commanders Veterans Council Unites for Legislative Priorities in Visalia
summary: On October 18, 2025, the California State Commanders Veterans Council (CSCVC) convened its quarterly conference in Visalia, California, bringing together more than 20 representatives from Military and Veterans Service Organizations (MSOs and VSOs) from across the state. The CSCVC serves as a unified voice for California’s veterans community—advocating for legislation, benefits, and policies that improve […]

title: From Protection to Prosecution: The New Face of DOJ
summary:
Federal Government Focus: School Board Controversy & FBI Achievements

Do you remember the controversy over the federal government's intervention in school board meetings? This episode delves into the Department of Justice's priorities under Merrick Garland and the involvement of the National Security Division in parental disagreements at school boards. Additionally, we highlight the FBI's achievements in combating violent crime, seizing illegal firearms and drugs, and arresting top criminals during the Trump administration. Is this the best use of federal resources? Should local or state law enforcement handle such issues? Discover the contrasting focuses and effectiveness between administrations.
